context_bundle.summary: Go context patterns for cancellation, timeouts, deadlines, and request-scoped values in concurrent applications

common_patterns: Background context: 'ctx := context.Background() // root context for main, init, tests'
Timeout: 'ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), 5*time.Second); defer cancel(); select { case <-time.After(10*time.Second): case <-ctx.Done(): return ctx.Err() }'
Cancellation: 'ctx, cancel := context.WithCancel(context.Background()); go func() { <-time.After(time.Second); cancel() }(); <-ctx.Done()'
HTTP request context: 'ctx := r.Context(); select { case <-ctx.Done(): return ctx.Err(); case result := <-ch: return result }'
Database with context: 'rows, err := db.QueryContext(ctx, "SELECT * FROM users"); if err != nil { return err }'

Propagation: 'func processRequest(ctx context.Context) error { return fetchData(ctx) }; func fetchData(ctx context.Context) error { req, _ := http.NewRequestWithContext(ctx, "GET", url, nil); resp, err := client.Do(req); return err }'
known_errors: context deadline exceeded: Increase timeout or optimize operation, check for blocking calls
context canceled: Handle cancellation gracefully, check ctx.Err() for reason
goroutine leak: Ensure goroutines respect context cancellation
context value not found: Check key type matches, use type assertion carefully
context not propagated: Pass context as first parameter to all functions
defer cancel not called: Always defer cancel() after creating context
